趕狗入窮巷.en: forcing one to a dead end (slang)

跌親.en: to tumble; to fall over; to fall down; to fall on one's face

較飛.en: an innocent victim or a scapegoat; to be a scapegoat for someone; to be a victim in place of someone else

追究責任.en: to call to account; to investigate and affix the responsibility for; to trace accountability and pursue liability

金魚黃.en: literally: goldfish yellow, a orange – yellowish colour

鑒識.en: to examine and appreciate something with the skills of a connoisseur

開埋井俾人食水.en: to work so hard for something (especially something that one has initiated from scratch) only for someone else to take the credit
開埋井俾人食水.pinyin: hoi1 maai4 zeng2 bei2 jan4 sik6 seoi2

陳村種.en: a spendthrift, someone who splashes away all the money as soon as they have some

雞仔媒人.en: a meddlesome person; a busybody; a matchmaker

面不改色.en: to keep a straight face; to stay calm

韌皮.en: normally describes a child who is naughty and not obliging; thick-skinned

頭帕.en: headwear of the Miao minority; a headscarf; a kerchief

頭頭尾尾.en: odds and ends; from the start to the end

飛沙走奶.en: black (coffee ,  tea); no sugar no milk

骰寶.en: 'sic bo' ,  'tai sai' ,  'dau siu' ,  'big and small' ,  'Fish-Prawn-Crab', a classic Chinese gambling game played with dice

鮑魚刷.en: a brush that is shaped like an abalone, normally used to clean toilet

鮮車怒馬.en: new carriage (driven by) fat horses, leading a luxurious life

鶼鰈情深.en: loving married couple; deeply in love

０靚.en: a member of a triad gang; a derogatory way to refer to a youngster [colloquial]

交朋結友.en: to meet and make new friends [written and colloquial]

嘴廟廟.en: to curl the lip (in disdain or to show discontent ,  disapproval) [colloquial]

多咀.en: to speak out of turn; to shoot one's mouth off; to talk out of place [colloquial]

心要熱,頭要冷.en: one should have a warm heart (passion and enthusiasm) and a cool head (a calm mind) [written and colloquial]
心要熱,頭要冷.pinyin: sam1 jiu3 jit6, tau4 jiu3 laang5

扮晒嘢.en: to be boastful; to claim to be very powerful [colloquial]

拉落水.en: to drag someone into a situation for which they are not to blame [colloquial]

拖馬.en: to call on fellow members for support to strengthen one's forces; to get backup [colloquial]

斬手指.en: to give up gambling; literally: to chop off one's fingers [colloquial]

日頭唔好講人，夜晚唔好講鬼.pinyin: jat6 tau2 m4 hou2 gong2 jan4, je6 maan5 m4 hou2 gong2 gwai2

是狗彈彈.en: whatever; anything will do; up to you, I don't care; anything goes [colloquial]

望就係咁望.en: one can only hope that is the case; one can only hope that one's wish will be fulfilled [colloquial]

棍底.en: Red Pole, a rank in a triad gang [colloquial]

正牌爛仔.en: literally: 'rascal with a license', a derogatory way to refer to police who abuse their authority [colloquial]

爆馬纜.en: to stay in a hotel room [colloquial]

莊士敦道.en: Johnston Road, a road in Hong Kong [written and colloquial]

試鐘.en: for a pimp to test out a prostitute and teach them the skills for the trade [colloquial]

䟕落.en: to trample on; to tread upon [colloquial]

鑊仔.en: literally : a small wok ; sex with an underage girl [colloquial]

開門見山講.en: to get straight to the point [colloquial]

馬永貞.en: Ma Wing Jing, a famous martial artist in the Qing dynasty [written and colloquial]
